member.name: T:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.UnitCell

member.summary: Instances of the Resource class contain information about arbitrary resources.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Resource class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Resource.SaveTo(System.IO.BinaryWriter,MindFusion.Scheduling.BinarySerializationContext)
member.summary: Saves the resource data to a binary stream.
member.param: Allows writing primitive data types to a binary stream.
The context object contains the file format revision number of the schedule being loaded. It also provides methods that facilitate reading and writing various data types from and to the stream.
member.remarks: The fields of the resource are saved as bytes into a binary stream, from which they can be loaded later by calling LoadFrom.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Resource.LoadFrom(System.IO.BinaryReader,MindFusion.Scheduling.BinarySerializationContext)
member.summary: Loads resource data from a binary stream.
member.param: Allows reading primitive data types from a binary stream.
The context object contains the file format revision number of the schedule being loaded. It also provides methods that facilitate reading and writing various data types from and to the stream.
member.remarks: The reader parameter wraps a stream that contains data by a previous call to the SaveTo method.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Resource.SaveTo(System.Xml.XmlElement,MindFusion.Scheduling.XmlSerializationContext)
member.summary: Saves the resource data to an XML document.
member.param: Allows adding data to the XML document.
The context object contains the file format revision number of the schedule being loaded. It also provides methods that facilitate reading and writing various data types from and to the XML document.
member.remarks: This method saves the resource properties as elements of an XML document.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Resource.LoadFrom(System.Xml.XmlElement,MindFusion.Scheduling.XmlSerializationContext)
member.summary: Loads resource data from an XML document.
member.param: Allows reading data from the XML document.
The context object contains the file format revision number of the schedule being loaded. It also provides methods that facilitate reading and writing various data types from and to the XML document.
member.remarks: The reader parameter wraps an XML document that contains data stored by a previous call to the SaveTo method.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Resource.SetCustomBrushes(MindFusion.Scheduling.CustomBrushes)
member.summary: Used during deserialization of older file formats to set the brushes from within derived classes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.Resource.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the string identifier of this resource.
member.remarks: If you need to change its value, make sure the identifier is always unique.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.Resource.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the resource.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.Resource.CustomBrushes
member.summary: Gets a CustomBrushes object associated with the resource.
member.remarks: This property defines a primary and a secondary brush used to paint the background of resource-related UI elements. The scheduled events for a resource can be displayed in their own columns in timetable, week range and resource views. In timetable view the primary brush is used to paint the non-work time cells, and the secondary brush is used to paint the work time cells. In week range view the two brushes are used to alternately paint odd and even weeks.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.Resource.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets custom data associated with the resource.
member.remarks: Use this property to store your custom data. The tag can be a value from a primitive data type or a complex object from the .NET class library or a class defined by you. If the tag is an instance of a value type, it will be serialized together with the object containing it when saving / loading the schedule. Reference types are serialized if marked with the [Serializable] attribute or if they implement the ISerializable interface.

member.summary: Requires repainting only.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.IProcessableItem
member.summary: Represents an event in time that can be processed by an IItemProcessor class. The event also implements the IComparable<IProcessableItem> interface, which enables events to be sorted in a particular order for processing.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.IProcessableItem.StartTime
member.summary: Gets the start time of the event.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.IProcessableItem.EndTime
member.summary: Gets the end time of the event.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.IProcessableItem.IsVisible
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the event should be processed.
member.remarks: Settings this to false will force the processor to completely ignore the item.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.IProcessableItem.IsAllDayEvent
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the event is considered an all-day event.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.IProcessableItem.IsAffectedByLayout
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the event's layout is affected by other events.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.IProcessableItem.AffectsLayout
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the event affects the layout of other events.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.IProcessableItem.AlwaysOnTop
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the event processing order. Events with AlwaysOnTop set to true will be processed after events with AlwaysOnTop set to false.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.IProcessableItem.IsSelected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the event is selected.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.IProcessableItem.Size
member.summary: Gets the size of the event, or 0 to indicate that the event size should be automatically calculated based on the available space.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.IProcessableItem.Position
member.summary: Gets the desired position of this item, or -1 to indicate that the event position should be calculated automatically depending on the processing order.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.SetViewport(System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the displayed time interval to the specified range, optionally changing the view resolution. If the interval is outside of the view range, the view range is expanded to include the interval.

The end of the interval to display.
true to change the view resolution if necessary; false to keep the current resolution and adjust only the scale.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.SetScale(System.Double)

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ResetDrag
member.summary: If there is a mouse drag operation in progress, it is canceled.
member.remarks: Call this method if a message box or a dialog must be displayed in response to various Click events, but you do not want the control to continue tracking the mouse afterwards.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.SuspendDrag
member.summary: Temporarily pauses the current mouse drag operation.
member.remarks: Use this method in conjunction with the ResumeDrag method to temporarily disable control response to user interactions. The most common scenario where you would use these two methods is when you want to display a modal dialog during user interaction without terminating it.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ResumeDrag
member.summary: Resumes the previously paused mouse drag operation.
member.remarks: Use this method in conjunction with the SuspendDrag method to temporarily disable control response to user interactions. The most common scenario where you would use these two methods is when you want to display a modal dialog during user interaction without terminating it.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.CurrentView
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the calendar view.
member.remarks: The control can display the schedule data in several different types of views. This property allows changing the current view and can be used to implement drill down into the schedule data by switching from more general to more specialized views.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.Schedule
member.summary: Gets or sets the schedule whose information should be displayed inside the calendar control.
member.remarks: You can easily substitute the schedule being displayed by the control at any time by simply assigning a new Schedule object to this property. You can also make two or more MindFusion.Scheduling controls display the same schedule.

member.summary: Gets the ItemSettings object used to customize the visualization of schedule items in all calendar views.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.Date
member.summary: Gets or sets the date currently displayed in the calendar.
member.remarks: This value is not used in a timetable view. To specify the dates displayed in timetable view, use TimetableSettings.Dates.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.EndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the last date displayed in the calendar.
member.remarks: This member is only valid in WeekRange and Resource views.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.Selection
member.summary: Gets a Selection object representing the current selection in the calendar.
member.remarks: Use ItemSelection to get the selection of schedule items.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ItemSelection
member.summary: Gets a list of all selected items.
member.remarks: Use Selection to get the collection of all selected time cells.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.DayStyles
member.summary: Gets a collection of DateStyle objects that allow customizing the appearance of specific days in the calendar.
member.remarks: Use this collection to assign a distinct style to a day or a range of days, overriding the default style of the current view. If there are several styles defined for the same day, the one with highest Priority is used.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.MonthStyles
member.summary: Gets a collection of DateStyle objects that allow customizing the appearance of specific months in the calendar.
member.remarks: Use this collection to assign a distinct style to a month or a range of months, overriding the default style of the current view. If there are several styles defined for the same month, the one with highest Priority is used.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.DayOfWeekStyles
member.summary: Gets a collection of DayOfWeekStyle objects that allow customizing the appearance of specific days of the week in the calendar.
member.remarks: Add DayOfWeekStyle objects to this collection to specify a distinct style for a day of the week. If several styles are defined for the same day, the one having the highest Priority is used.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ShowToolTips
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the calendar displays tooltips.
member.remarks: Tooltips can be displayed for schedule items and for the headers of the timetable view.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.AllowInplaceEdit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether users are allowed to edit items interactively.
member.remarks: If this property is disabled, users cannot edit item's text interactively. Controlling the editing of item text can be done by handling the ItemInplaceEditStarting and ItemInplaceEditEnding events.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.AllowInplaceCreate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether users are allowed to create items interactively.
member.remarks: If this property is disabled, users cannot create items interactively. If it is enabled and InteractiveItemType is not null, a new schedule item of the specified type is created when users start typing in a time cell. This raises the ItemCreating event, which lets your application validate the operation or cancel it.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.AllowAutoScroll
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control scrolls automatically its contents when users drag items near the edge of the client rectangle.
member.remarks: Automatic scrolling starts when a schedule item or a selection of items is dragged near the borders of the calendar contents rectangle. The contents rectangle is the part of a calendar view that contains all time cells and excludes the headers. If the mouse is moved outside the contents rectangle, the scrolling stops.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.Cursor
member.summary: Gets or sets the cursor that is displayed when the mouse pointer is over the calendar.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.HiddenItemsCursor
member.summary: Gets or sets the cursor that is displayed when the mouse pointer is over the hidden items cue icon.
member.remarks: The hidden items cue icon is shown if ItemSettings.ShowMoreItemsCue is enabled and there are schedule items that are not currently visible because of insufficient space.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ItemMoveCursor

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ItemHResizeCursor

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ItemVResizeCursor
member.summary: Gets or sets the cursor that is displayed when the mouse pointer is over the vertical resize area of an item.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ItemDragCursor
member.summary: Gets or sets the cursor that is displayed when an item is being dragged.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ItemNoDragCursor
member.summary: Gets or sets the cursor that is displayed when an item is dragged over a location that cannot contain items.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ColumnResizeCursorV
member.summary: Gets or set the cursor that is displayed when a column can be resized or is being resized in a vertical Timetable view.
member.remarks: To let users resize the columns in a timetable view, set TimetableSettings.AllowResizeColumns to Enabled.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ColumnResizeCursorH
member.summary: Gets or set the cursor that is displayed when a column can be resized or is being resized in a horizontal Timetable view.
member.remarks: To let users resize the columns in a timetable view, set TimetableSettings.AllowResizeColumns to Enabled.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.RowHeaderResizeCursor
member.summary: Gets or set the cursor that is displayed when a row header can be resized or is being resized in a Resource view.
member.remarks: To let users resize the row header in a Resource view, set ResourceViewSettings.AllowResizeRowHeader to Enabled.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.DateTimeFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the DateTimeFormatInfo object that specifies how to format and display all dates within the calendar.
member.remarks: If this property is not set, the calendar uses the DateFormatInfo from the associated Culture.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.SystemCalendar
member.summary: Gets or sets the System.Globalization.Calendar object to use when displaying dates in the control.
member.remarks: If this property is not set, the control uses the calendar of the associated culture.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.InteractiveItemType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of a Item derived class whose instance should be created when a user starts typing while the calendar control has the keyboard focus.
member.remarks: If this property is set to null, users cannot create items interactively.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.CustomDraw
member.summary: Gets or sets which UI elements of the calendar should be custom drawn.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ButtonOffset
member.summary: Gets or set the offset of the navigation buttons, displayed in the views' headers.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ButtonSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the navigation buttons, displayed in the views' headers.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.Theme
member.summary: Gets or sets the theme applied to the calendar control UI elements.
member.remarks: You cannot specify the value Custom for this property. In order to apply a custom theme, either assign the theme to the CustomTheme property of the Calendar control or pass it as an argument to the ApplyTheme method.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.CustomTheme
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom theme applied to the control.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.FirstWeekendDay
member.summary: Gets or sets the first weekend day in the calendar.
member.remarks: Specifies which day to regard as start of the weekend.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.DelayInplaceEdit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the in-place editing of an item is delayed for a second when the item is clicked.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.Contacts
member.summary: Gets the contacts whose schedule to display when GroupType is set to GroupByContacts.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.Resources
member.summary: Gets the resources whose schedule to display in the control when GroupType is set to GroupByResources.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.Locations
member.summary: Gets the locations whose schedule to display in the timetable when GroupType is set to GroupByLocations.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.Tasks
member.summary: Gets the tasks whose schedule to display in the control when Calendar is set to GroupByTasks.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.GroupType
member.summary: Gets or sets the grouping criteria for the Timetable, WeekRange, List and Resource views.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.CustomGroupType
member.summary: Gets or sets a runtime type of the resources to group by.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.SecondaryGroupType
member.summary: Gets or sets the secondary grouping criteria for the Resource view.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.CustomSecondaryGroupType
member.summary: Gets or sets a runtime type of the secondary resources to group by.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.TertiaryGroupType
member.summary: Gets or sets the tertiary grouping criteria for the Resource view.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.CustomTertiaryGroupType
member.summary: Gets or sets a runtime type of the tertiary resources to group by.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ContactNameFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets how to format and display contact names in the timetable header.
member.remarks: Use the capital letters F, M and L as placeholders for the First, Middle and Last names. Any other character will be displayed unchanged.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.AllowDrag
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can initiate a drag operation within the control.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ItemDragKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the modifier key that lets users start an OLE drag-and-drop operation when they drag an item.
member.remarks: By default, a dragged schedule item can be dropped only inside the Calendar control. Users can drag an item to another control on the form or to an external application by pressing the modifier key set in this property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ItemChangeResourceKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the modifier key, which lets users drag items between different contacts, resources, locations or tasks in a grouped view.
member.remarks: By default an item dragged in a grouped view can be dropped only into a column associated with the original contact, location or task of the item. This behavior can be overridden by pressing a modifier key while dragging. That allows dropping the item into a column of a different contact, location or task, thus changing the original contact, location or task.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ItemCloneKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the modifier key, which when pressed allows users to interactively clone items.
member.remarks: If the user starts dragging an item (or items) when the key specified as a value of this property is pressed, an exact duplicate of the dragged item is created and the user continues dragging the newly created item instead of the original one.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.RescheduleRecurrenceKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the modifier key, which when pressed allows users to interactively reschedule recurrent items.
member.remarks: If the user drags a recurrent item when the key specified as a value of this property is pressed, the recurrence is automatically adjusted to match the new item location. Recurrence rescheduling is not recorded in the undo history.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.LocalizationInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the LocalizationInfo object containing the settings used to customize various UI controls within the calendar.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ItemTooltipFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format of item tooltips.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.MinItemLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimal length of interactively created items, expressed in minutes.
member.remarks: Specify 0 for no item length restrictions.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.TextRendering
member.summary: Gets or sets the text rendering mode.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.RealGroupType
member.summary: Gets the actual group type. This is the same as GroupType unless the corresponding resource collection is empty, in which case it returns None.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.RealSecondaryGroupType
member.summary: Gets the actual group type. This is the same as SecondaryGroupType unless the corresponding resource collection is empty, in which case it returns None.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.RealTertiaryGroupType
member.summary: Gets the actual group type. This is the same as TertiaryGroupType unless the corresponding resource collection is empty, in which case it returns None.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.SecondWeekendDay
member.summary: Gets the second weekend day.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.IsRightToLeft
member.summary: Gets a flag indicating whether the calendar is in a Right-To-Left mode.
member.remarks: This property is for compatibility with MindFusion.Scheduling and in MindFusion.Scheduling.Compact always returns false.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.IsGrouped
member.summary: Gets a flag indicating whether grouping is enabled, i.e. RealGroupType is either GroupByContacts, GroupByResources, GroupByLocations or GroupByTasks.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ControlAppearance
member.summary: Gets or sets the visual style of the calendar child controls.
member.remarks: ControlStyle can be used only if this property is set to Custom.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.ControlStyle
member.summary: Gets a ControlStyle object that allows customizing the visualization of the calendar child controls.
member.remarks: Members of the ControlStyle class let you customize the appearance of the button and scrollbar child controls contained in the calendar control. This property is ignored if ControlAppearance is set to System.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.EnsureVisibleSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the selected cells should be automatically brought into view.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.KeepItemSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item selection is preserved when an item from the selection is clicked.
member.remarks: If the property is set to false, only the clicked item is selected.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.EnableKeyboard
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the selection can be manipulated through the keyboard.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.EnableDragCreate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether items are created merely by dragging in the control.
member.remarks: By default, the items in MindFusion.Scheduling are created interactively by selecting a time range in the current view and typing. Setting this property to true overrides this behavior and enables users to create items by clicking and dragging.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.StartEditAfterModify

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.Calendar.InplaceCancelOnEscape
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to cancel the changes when the user presses Escape during item in-place editing.

member.remarks: Specify Disabled for this property to always hide the scroller, Enabled to always show it and Unspecified to let the Calendar control decide when to show the scroller.

member.summary: Raised when the user is about to delete a schedule item.
member.remarks: This event can be used to prevent users from deleting specific non-recurring items by pressing DEL. This event is raised once for each element of the item selection. To control the deletion of recurring items, handle the RecurringItemDeleting event.

member.summary: Raised when the user is about to delete a recurring item.

member.summary: Nothing significant has been hit.

member.summary: An item has been hit in its resizing area.

member.summary: An item has been hit in its resizing area.

member.summary: The 'more' icon has been hit. This is the icon that is displayed when one or more items don't fit in a cell.

member.summary: The main header in a Month view has been hit.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the HitTestInfo class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the HitTestInfo class.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.HitTestInfo.Result
member.summary: Gets or sets the result of a hit-testing operation.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.HitTestInfo.Date
member.summary: Gets or sets the date, which has been hit-tested. This is valid only if the result of the hit-testing operation is appropriate (as indicated by the Result property).

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.HitTestInfo.EndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the end date of the hit-tested interval. This is valid only if the result of the hit-testing operation is appropriate (as indicated by the Result property).

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.HitTestInfo.ExactDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the exact date, which has been hit-tested. This is only valid in a Timetable view and represents the exact hit-tested date in contrast with Date, which, in this particular case, represents the start date of the hit-tested cell.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.HitTestInfo.Item
member.summary: Gets or sets the item which has been hit or null if none.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.HitTestInfo.GlobalItemBounds
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ItemBounds and ItemBoundsNoBands properties are expressed in global coordinates.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.HitTestInfo.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets a rectangle associated with the hit object, expressed in client coordinates.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.HitTestInfo.ItemBounds
member.summary: Gets or sets the bounding rectangle of the hit-tested item.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.HitTestInfo.ItemBoundsNoBands
member.summary: Gets or sets the bounding rectangle of the hit-tested item, excluding the move and size bands.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.HitTestInfo.Resource
member.summary: Gets or sets the resource relevant to the hit element. This is only valid in a Timetable, WeekRange and Resource views with GroupType set to Resources.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.HitTestInfo.ResourcePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the resource path relevant to the hit element. This is only valid in Resource view and is related to multiple grouping.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.HitTestInfo.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text related to the hit element.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.HitTestInfo.Index
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the hit element (if relevant).

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.HitTestInfo.ShouldStop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the hit-testing has to stop.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.HitTestInfo.TestItems
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether to test items.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.HitTestInfo.ListLane
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the hit-tested lane in a List view.

member.summary: Gets the end of the time interval represented by this cell.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.ITimeCell.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets the bounding rectangle of the cell.
member.remarks: This is an 'in/out' property. That is, its value is supplied to the processor but the processor may change it while operating.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.ITimeCell.RenderBounds
member.summary: Gets the bounding rectangle of the cell, rounded to integer value.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.ITimeCell.IsVisible
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the cell is currently visible.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.ITimeCell.ContainsHiddenItemsAbove
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this cell contains invisible items, which are positioned before the items that are currently laid out in the cell.
member.remarks: This is an 'out' property. That is, its value is set by the item processor and is available to the caller at the end of the processing.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.ITimeCell.ContainsHiddenItemsBelow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this cell contains invisible items, which are positioned after the items that are currently laid out in the cell.
member.remarks: This is an 'out' property. That is, its value is set by the item processor and is available to the caller at the end of the processing.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.ITimeCell.VisibleItemCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of items that the processor will be able to fit in this cell.
member.remarks: This is an 'out' property. That is, its value is set by the item processor and is available to the caller at the end of the processing.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.MainHeaderSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the main header.
member.remarks: A value of 0 causes the calendar to automatically calculate a header size based on the size of the header font.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.SubHeaderSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the secondary header.
member.remarks: A value of 0 causes the calendar to automatically calculate a header size based on the size of the header font.

member.summary: Gets or sets the size of time cells.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.DayHeaderBrush
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush used to paint the subheader where the all-day items are displayed.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.InfoHeaderBrush
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush used to paint the info header.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the start time of the timetable, expressed in minutes since the beginning of the day.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.EndTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the end time of the timetable, expressed in minutes since the beginning of the day.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.RealEndTime
member.summary: Gets the real end time, i.e. if EndTime is greater than StartTime, returns EndTime, otherwise, returns EndTime + 1440.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.CellTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time length of a single cell in a timetable view, accurate to the nearest second.
member.remarks: Valid values for this property range from 1 second to 1 hour.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.WorkTimeStartHour
member.summary: Gets or sets the start hour of the work time interval.
member.remarks: This property and WorkTimeEndHour specify the working time period, whose cells are usually displayed in a different style as set in WorkTimeCellStyle. To use the same style for all cells in the timetable view, set WorkTimeCellStyle to a new empty Style.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.WorkTimeEndHour
member.summary: Gets or sets the end hour of the work time interval.
member.remarks: This property and WorkTimeStartHour specify the working time period, whose cells are usually displayed in a different style as set in WorkTimeCellStyle. To use the same style for all cells in the timetable view, set WorkTimeCellStyle to a new empty Style.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.RealWorkTimeEndHour
member.summary: Gets the real work time end hour, that is, if WorkTimeEndHour is greater than WorkTimeStartHour, returns WorkTimeEndHour, otherwise, returns WorkTimeEndHour + 24.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.MinuteFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets how to format and display minutes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.ShowAM
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the AM and PM suffixes are displayed.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.TwelveHourFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use a 12-hour format.
member.remarks: This property is obsolete. It is used only when HourFormat is an empty string.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.HourFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format of the hours displayed in the timeline.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.ShowMinutesInHourHeaders
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display the minutes of each hour in the timeline header when it displays whole hour cells.
member.remarks: Whole hour cells are displayed when the hours are divisible by the specified CellTime.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.SecondTimelineStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a second timeline is displayed in addition to the primary one.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.SecondTimelineOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset in hours of the second timeline.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.ShowCurrentTime
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display the current time in the timeline.

member.summary: Gets or sets the color used to mark the current time in the timeline.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.NowFillColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the fill color used to mark the current time in the timeline.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.MaxAllDayItems
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of all-day items visible in the columns headers at a time.
member.remarks: The all-day items header is automatically resized to hold all items up to the number set in this property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.AllowResizeColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the users can resize timetable columns.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.HeaderDateFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets how to format and display dates in the timetable header.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.MinColumnSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the smallest size allowed for timetable columns.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.MinItemSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the smallest size allowed for schedule items.
member.remarks: If there is not enough space in a column to display all related items, the items that do not fit remain invisible.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.MaxItemSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the largest size allowed for schedule items.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.ColumnBandSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the bands displayed on the left/top side of each timetable column.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.ShowNavigationButtons
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Timetable view displays navigation buttons.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.ShowMoreItemsCue
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display a 'more items' icon in the timeline header when some items in a timetable column are not currently visible.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.HeaderShadowStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style of the shadows cast by headers.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.HeaderShadowColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the shadows cast by headers.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.HeaderShadowOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset of the shadows from the headers that cast them.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the view orientation.
member.remarks: A vertical timetable view displays cells for the same daytime in a row, and cells for the same date in a column. A horizontal timetable view displays cells for the same time of the day in a column, and cells for the same date in a row.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.RotateHeaderTexts
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the header texts are rotated in a view with Horizontal orientation.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.RotateTimelineTexts
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the timeline texts are rotated in a view with Horizontal orientation.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.UseZoom
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use the associated zoom factor or the fixed cell height when displaying cells.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.ZoomFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the zoom factor when zoom is enabled.
member.remarks: To make the whole timeline visible at a time, set this to 100.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.GeneralFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the string to use when formatting times in the timeline.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.GroupHours
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether hours displayed in the timeline are grouped.
member.remarks: Certain conditions prevent hours from grouping, such as when the hours are not divisible by the specified CellTime.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.GroupHourCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of hours to group when GroupHours is set to Enabled.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.ShowWorkTime
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the work time should be displayed with different style.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.SelectWholeDayOnHeaderClick
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the whole day is selected when the user clicks in the column's header.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.ScrollStep
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of days to scroll when the user clicks the navigation buttons.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.ReverseGrouping
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether grouping (if enabled) will be performed first by the resource, and then by the date.
member.remarks: By default grouping is done first by available dates, then by the resources specified in the current grouping type. Setting this property to Enabled reverses this behavior.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.ShowPadding
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether padding should be disabled. Padding of items appear when the items are not aligned to cells.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.EnableSnapping
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether custom snapping is enabled.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.SnapInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom snap interval.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.ExpandActiveItemOn
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the active item should ignore collisions.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.EnableDayItems
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether items longer than 24 hours are displayed in the day header or not.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.ShowItemSpans
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item time spans are also drawn in the left band of the corresponding column.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.ItemOffset
member.summary: Gets or set the distance between the first item and its adjoining cell side.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.EnableAutoDayChange
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Timetable view will automatically scroll one day forth and back when the user moves the mouse at the top or at the bottom of the view.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.EnableCollisions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item collision processing is enabled.
member.remarks: Turn this flag off if you don't need collision detection to improve performance.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.EnableWorkOnWeekends
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to color the work-time cells in weekend days.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.IsHorizontal
member.summary: Gets a flag indicating whether the view is horizontal.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.IsVertical
member.summary: Gets a flag indicating whether the view is vertical.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.TimetableSettings.IsRound
member.summary: Gets whether the current settings rounding is enabled.
member.remarks: Rounding means that the hours can be represented as a single spanning cell in the timeline.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule
member.summary: Represents a timetable of scheduled events. In the model-view architecture, Schedule instances are the documents whose data is displayed by Calendar instances - the views.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.CurrentVersion
member.summary: Current version of schedule file format.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Schedule class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.RegisterNativeClasses
member.summary: Registers the item and resource types native to MindFusion.Scheduling.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes any resources used by this Schedule object.
member.remarks: It is important to call Dispose on the object when you are done using it, in order to stop the schedule's timer used to trigger reminder events.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.SaveTo(System.String,MindFusion.Scheduling.ContentType)
member.summary: Saves the schedule to a file.
member.param: The path of the file to save to.
Specifies whether to save the data in binary or XML format.
member.remarks: Saves the schedule data into a binary or XML file. Use LoadFrom to restore the data later.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.LoadFrom(System.String,MindFusion.Scheduling.ContentType)
member.summary: Loads schedule data from a file.
member.param: The name of the file from which to load the schedule.
Specifies whether the data is in binary or XML format.
member.remarks: This method loads the schedule data from a file where it was previously saved by a call to SaveTo. Any data contained in the schedule is discarded before the items stored in the file are loaded.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.SaveToStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Saves the schedule to a binary stream.
member.param: The stream to save the schedule to.
member.remarks: Saves the schedule data as bytes in a binary stream. Use LoadFromStream to restore the data later.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.LoadFromStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Loads schedule data from a binary stream.
member.param: The stream to load the schedule from.
member.remarks: This method loads from a binary stream data previously saved there by SaveToStream. Any data contained in the schedule is discarded before the items stored in the stream are loaded.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.SaveToXml(System.Xml.XmlDocument)
member.summary: Saves the schedule to an XML document.
member.param: An XmlDocument object that allows adding data to the XML document.
member.remarks: Saves the schedule data as tags in an XML document. Use LoadFromXml to restore the schedule data later.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.LoadFromXml(System.Xml.XmlDocument)
member.summary: Loads schedule data from an XML document.
member.param: An XmlDocument instance that allows reading data from the XML document.
member.remarks: Loads schedule items from an XML document previously created by SaveTo. Any data contained in the schedule is discarded before the items stored in the reader are loaded.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.SaveToString(MindFusion.Scheduling.ContentType)
member.summary: Encodes the schedule into a string.
member.param: Specifies whether the schedule data should be saved in binary or XML format.
member.returns: A string containing all schedule data.
member.remarks: Saves the schedule data into a base64-encoded string. Use LoadFromString to restore the data later.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.LoadFromString(System.String,MindFusion.Scheduling.ContentType)
member.summary: Decodes schedule data from a string previously created by SaveToString.
member.param: A string that contains schedule data.
Specifies whether the data is stored in binary or XML format.
member.remarks: This method loads from a string data previously saved by SaveToString.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.GetAllItems(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of all events, including recurrent item instances, scheduled to occur in the specified time interval.
member.param: Time interval start.
Time interval end.
member.returns: A collection that contains the events scheduled to occur in the specified period.
member.remarks: If a recurring event occurs in the specified interval, each occurrence is represented by an Item instance whose RecurrenceState is set to Occurrence.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.GetFreePeriod(System.DateTime,System.DateTime,MindFusion.Scheduling.ItemCollection,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Returns the next period after the specified date with the specified duration, which is not occupied by items.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.GetFreePeriod(System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Returns the next period after the specified date with the specified duration which is not occupied by items.
member.param: The start date of the interval in which to search for a free period.
The end date of the interval in which to search for a free period.
The required minimum duration of the period.
member.returns: A .NET DateTime object representing the start time of the period found or DateTime.MinValue if none.
member.remarks: If there are recurring items associated with a resource in the specified collection, the function execution might take very long if a period with the specified duration doesn't exist.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.GetFreePeriod(System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan,MindFusion.Scheduling.ResourceCollection)

The required minimum duration of the period.
The resources whose items should be considered when looking for the free period.
member.returns: A .NET DateTime object representing the start time of the period found or DateTime.MinValue if none.
member.remarks: If there are recurring items associated with a resource in the specified collection, the function execution might take very long if a period with the specified duration doesn't exist.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.StartCompositeOperation
member.summary: Starts recording undo/redo commands into a CompositeCommand.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.CancelCompositeOperation
member.summary: Stops recording undo/redo commands into a CompositeCommand and discards the records created so far.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.CommitCompositeOperation
member.summary: Stops recording undo/redo commands into a CompositeCommand and saves the composite in the history queue.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.StartItemChange(MindFusion.Scheduling.Item)
member.summary: Begins a modification on the specified item. The modification is not registered with the undo manager until after EndItemChange is invoked.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.EndItemChange(MindFusion.Scheduling.ChangeItemCommand)
member.summary: Ends a previously started modification on an item.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.StartTotalChange
member.summary: Starts recording undo/redo commands for all items in the schedule into a CompositeCommand.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.ExecuteCommand(MindFusion.Scheduling.Command)
member.summary: Executes the specified command on this schedule.

member.summary: Gets all resources defined in the Schedule.

member.summary: Gets all locations defined in the Schedule.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.DisableReminders
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to completely disable reminders in the whole schedule.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.DisableItemTimeChecks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to disable notification checks for item's start/end times.

member.summary: Gets or sets the interval between reminder checks, expressed in seconds.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.Changed
member.summary: Raised when items are added or removed from the schedule or when the schedule is loaded.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.ItemsChanged
member.summary: Raised when the Items collection has been changed.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.ItemReminderTriggered
member.summary: Raised when the reminder for an item is triggered.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.ItemEndTimeTriggered
member.summary: Raised when the reminder for an item is triggered, but taking into consideration the item's end time for the purpose.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.TaskReminderTriggered
member.summary: Raised when the reminder for a task is triggered.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.ItemsStarted
member.summary: Raised when the current time (as returned by DateTime.Now) reaches the start time of one or more items.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.ItemsEnded
member.summary: Raised when the current time (as returned by DateTime.Now) reaches the end of one or more items.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.ExceptionCreated
member.summary: Raised when a recurrence exception item is created.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.RecurrenceReset
member.summary: Raised when the recurrence pattern associated with an item has been reset, causing all associated exception items to be lost.
member.remarks: The recurrence is reset when the value of any of the properties that define it is changed. The recurrence is also reset when it is associated to or dissociated from an item.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.ItemStartTimeChanged
member.summary: Raised when the StartTime property of an item in this Schedule has changed. The ItemTimeEventArgs.Time property provides the previous StartTime value of the item.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.ItemEndTimeChanged
member.summary: Raised when the EndTime property of an item in this Schedule has changed. The ItemTimeEventArgs.Time property provides the previous EndTime value of the item.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.ItemVisualsChanged
member.summary: Raised when the appearance of an item in the schedule has changed.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.InstantiateItem
member.summary: Raised when deserializing a custom item whose type has not been registered.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.InstantiateResource
member.summary: Raised when deserializing a custom resource whose type has not been registered.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.SerializeTag
member.summary: Raised during XML serialization to enable users to perform custom serialization of the tag values of items and resources.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.DeserializeTag
member.summary: Raised during XML deserialization to enable users to perform custom deserialization of the tag values of items and resources.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.ActionUndone
member.summary: Raised when an action is undone.
member.remarks: This event is raised during calls to Undo. It is raised both for top-level commands and for the constituent actions of composite commands.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Scheduling.Schedule.ActionRedone
member.summary: Raised when an action is redone.
member.remarks: This event is raised during calls to Redo. It is raised both for top-level commands and for the constituent actions of composite commands.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Scheduling.Item.SaveTo(System.IO.BinaryWriter,MindFusion.Scheduling.BinarySerializationContext)
member.summary: Saves the item data to a binary stream.
member.param: Allows writing primitive data types to a binary stream.
The context object contains the file format revision number of the schedule being loaded. It also provides methods that facilitate reading and writing various data types from and to the stream.

Specifies the start of the time period.
Specifies the end of the time period.
A list of Resource instances all of which must be related to the items.
A .NET Calendar instance that is used to interpret recurrence patterns in the schedule.
member.returns: A collection that contains the events scheduled to occur in the specified period for the specified resource.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.HeaderStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style of the time-period header, displayed above the day-names header.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.ShowDayOfWeek
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the day names are displayed in the header area of the WeekRange view.
member.remarks: The day names are obtained from the DateTimeFormat property of the Calendar class, if it isn't a null reference, or from the corresponding DateTimeFormat property of the CultureInfo object assigned to calendar's Culture.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.OddMonthsBrush
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush used to paint the background of all odd months' areas in the WeekRange view.
member.remarks: If this value is set to null, the control uses the brush from the associated style to paint the odd months' background.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.EvenMonthsBrush
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush used to paint the background of all even months' areas in the WeekRange view.
member.remarks: If this value is set to null, the control uses the brush from the associated style to paint the even months' background.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.TimePeriodHeaderHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the time-period header in the WeekRange view.
member.remarks: A value of 0 causes the height to be calculated automatically based on the size of the header font.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.ReferenceHeaderHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the resource header in the WeekRange view.
member.remarks: This header is where the contact, task, location or resource names are displayed, depending on the calendar GroupType. A value of 0 causes the height to be calculated automatically based on the size of the header font.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.DayNamesHeaderHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the day-names header in the WeekRange view.
member.remarks: A value of 0 causes the height to be calculated automatically based on the size of the header font.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.NumberOfDays
member.summary: Gets the total number of days displayed in the WeekRange view.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.StartDate
member.summary: Gets the start date displayed in the WeekRange view.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.EndDate
member.summary: Gets the end date displayed in the WeekRange view.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.VisibleRows
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of weeks visible at a time.
member.remarks: Used only when ViewStyle is set to WeekPerRow.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.RealVisibleRows
member.summary: Gets the real number of visible rows. This number equals VisibleRows if the view is SingleMonth and is always 3 if the view is SingleWeek.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.DaysPerRow
member.summary: Gets the real number of days to display on a row.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.GroupWeekends
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether weekend days are grouped in a single calendar cell. Weekends are always grouped in a SingleWeek view.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.RealGroupWeekends
member.summary: Gets the real group weekends flag. This equals to GroupWeekends if the view style is WeekPerRow and is always true if the style is SingleWeek.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.ViewStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style of the WeekRange view.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.Margin
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between the outermost border and the rest of the calendar contents.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.DayDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between adjacent days.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.TitleFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format of the calendar's title.
member.remarks: The format specifiers that can be used in the format string are listed in the MSDN's DateTimeFormatInfo class topic.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.TitleSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets the string used as a separator in the calendar's title.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.GroupWeekendsTitleSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets the separator string displayed between the weekend day names when GroupWeekends is enabled.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.DayOfWeekFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the display format of the names of the days of the week.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.HeaderShadowStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style of the headers' shadows.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.HeaderShadowColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the headers' shadows.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.HeaderShadowOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset of the shadows from the headers that cast them.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.WeekRangeSettings.VisibleColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns visible when the GroupType is enabled.

member.summary: The days in the calendar month view are positioned horizontally.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.LocalizationInfo.RecurrenceDailyOnePattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern used for daily recurrences with DailyRecurrence set to ByDayInterval and Days value set to 1.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.LocalizationInfo.RecurrenceDailyTwoPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern used for daily recurrences with DailyRecurrence set to ByDayInterval and Days value set to more than 1.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.LocalizationInfo.RecurrenceDailyThreePattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern used for daily recurrences with DailyRecurrence set to EveryWorkday.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.LocalizationInfo.RecurrenceDailyFourPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern used for daily recurrences with DailyRecurrence set to EveryWeekend.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.LocalizationInfo.RecurrenceWeeklyOnePattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern used for weekly recurrences with Weeks value set to 1.
member.remarks: Use the [DaysOfWeek] parameter as a placeholder for the Recurrence.DaysOfWeek value.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.LocalizationInfo.RecurrenceWeeklyTwoPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern used for weekly recurrences with Weeks value set to more than 1.
member.remarks: Use the [DaysOfWeek] and [Weeks] parameters as placeholders for the Recurrence.DaysOfWeek and Recurrence.Weeks values respectively.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.LocalizationInfo.RecurrenceMonthlyOnePattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern used for monthly recurrences with MonthlyRecurrence set to ByDayNumber.
member.remarks: Use the [DayOfMonth] and [Months] parameters as placeholders for the Recurrence.DayOfMonth and Recurrence.Months values respectively.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.LocalizationInfo.RecurrenceMonthlyTwoPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern used for monthly recurrences with MonthlyRecurrence set to ByDayType.
member.remarks: Use the [Occurrence], [Day] and [Months] parameters as placeholders for the Recurrence.Occurrence, Recurrence.Day and Recurrence.Months values respectively.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.LocalizationInfo.RecurrenceYearlyOnePattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern used for yearly recurrences with YearlyRecurrence set to SpecificDate.
member.remarks: Use the [MonthOfYear] and [DayOfMonth] parameters as placeholders for the Recurrence.MonthOfYear and Recurrence.DayOfMonth values respectively.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.LocalizationInfo.RecurrenceYearlyTwoPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern used for yearly recurrences with YearlyRecurrence set to ByDayType.
member.remarks: Use the [Occurrence], [Day] and [MonthOfYear] parameters as placeholders for the Recurrence.Occurrence, Recurrence.Day and Recurrence.MonthOfYear values respectively.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.LocalizationInfo.RecurrenceIntervalPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern used for recurrences with RecurrencePattern set to TimeInterval.
member.remarks: Use the [Interval.Days], [Interval.Hours], [Interval.Minutes] and [Interval.Seconds] parameters as placeholders for the Recurrence.Interval.Days, Recurrence.Interval.Hours, Recurrence.Interval.Minutes and Recurrence.Interval.Seconds values respectively.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.LocalizationInfo.RecurrenceStartDatePattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern used for denoting the start date of a recurrence.
member.remarks: Use the [StartDate] parameter as a placeholder for the Recurrence.StartDate value.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.LocalizationInfo.RecurrenceEndDatePattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern used for denoting the end date of a recurrence.
member.remarks: Use the [EndDate] parameter as a placeholder for the return value from the Recurrence.GetEndDate() method.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.LocalizationInfo.RecurrenceTimeOnePattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern used for denoting the start and end time of a recurrence.
member.remarks: Use the [StartTime] and [EndTime] parameters as placeholders for the StartTime and EndTime of recurrences.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.LocalizationInfo.RecurrenceTimeTwoPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern used for denoting the time of a recurrence.
member.remarks: Use the [StartTime] parameter as a placeholder for the StartTime of recurrences.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.ResourceViewSettings.TimelineScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale factor of the timeline.
member.remarks: Usually the size of the cells in the Resource view is calculated to be large enough so that the texts in the timeline can fit without clipping. By using values other than 100 for this property, you can scale up or down the precalculated size of the cells.

member.summary: Gets the settings for the bottom timeline.

member.summary: Gets the settings for the middle timeline.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Scheduling.WinForms.ResourceViewSettings.TopTimelineSettings
member.summary: Gets the settings for the top timeline.

member.summary: Gets or sets the time modification interval when the user scrolls the view.
